title: Tracking Issue for warning on unused lifetimes (by default)

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
This issue is tracking the transition of the `unused_lifetimes` lint to warn-by-default (or higher).


### About tracking issues

Tracking issues are used to record the overall progress of implementation.
They are also used as hubs connecting to other relevant issues, e.g., bugs or open design questions.
A tracking issue is however *not* meant for large scale discussion, questions, or bug reports about a feature.
Instead, open a dedicated issue for the specific matter and add the relevant feature gate label.

### Steps

Several concerns were raised as blocking in #92386:

* [ ] [Permit underscores to silence the lint](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92386#issuecomment-1015740199)
* [ ] [Avoid warning on semver-exposed lifetimes](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92386#issuecomment-1015723902)

Additionally, a plausible half step was [suggested](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92386#issuecomment-1016025192) that enabling the lint for `impl` lifetime declarations would likely have no semver compatibility concerns and so be feasible to land more quickly.

### Known bugs (list may be incomplete)

* [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/74165
* [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/72587
* [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/94307


Prior "tracking" issue: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/41960
